channel.title: Webclient help
channel.description:
Hey guys I made a webclient for my server and it worked well, downloaded cache and everything loaded.. but I have a problem..
Im running the server off my laptop(run.bat) it allows me to enter the server on the webclient by going through my localhost,but no one else can enter the server except for me because it only allows me to enter. How do I allow everyone to enter my server and not just me..
thanks in advance

item.title: Webclient help
item.dc:creator: @mich702703 mich702703
item.description:
@mich702703 wrote:

I have done this but always: cant connect to server

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient help
item.dc:creator: @Superd00d Superd00d
item.description:
@Superd00d wrote:

0wn3r k4t3:

Did you port forward correctly? Allow port 43594 access through your firewall?

That has nothing to do with web client only connecting for himself. @ Topic maker,
When you used the tutorial (Ric’s for example) You never ONCE see a part mentioning no-ip, or how it will connect to your server. That is the problem. There is no way you can connect to your server except by localhost! So go search up “localhost” or “127.0.0.1” and change that to your no-ip.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient help
item.dc:creator: @0wn3r_k4t3 0wn3r k4t3
item.description:
@0wn3r_k4t3 wrote:

Did you port forward correctly? Allow port 43594 access through your firewall?

item.title: Webclient help
item.dc:creator: @agrey123 agrey123
item.description:
@agrey123 wrote:

ok guys now i tried giving my NORMAL client to my friend and he cant even connect to my normal client even though on rune-locus it says its online! i think its something to do with the general client, is there any files i must open to actually set a server inside of it?wat do you think??

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient help
item.dc:creator: @Cammypvpreborn Cammypvpreborn
item.description:
@Cammypvpreborn wrote:

In the No-ip DUC program you have to make sure you click the BOX so that face has rosy checks. if tht works then run, run.bat then Open up your webclient. If you and only you can log on with the webclient means you have to make a webclient that has your IP in it or i have no clue.
I HOPE THIS HELPED!

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient help
item.dc:creator: @agrey123 agrey123
item.description:
@agrey123 wrote:

bump, any help plz?

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient help
item.dc:creator: @Ace1 Ace.
item.description:
@Ace1 wrote:

Best of luck on a reply,

I’m getting the same problem. Only I can host my server, not anybody else. I’ve tried letting my friend host and it didn’t work, nobody else could connect as they received the “Error Connecting To Server” line.

It might be something to do with the No-Ip (if you’re using that), that’s what I thought.

Read full topic
